input: Anne is blue. Anne is nice. Anne is red. Anne is rough. Anne is round. Anne is smart. Bob is blue. Dave is blue. Dave is rough. Dave is smart. Harry is blue. Harry is furry. If something is furry then it is round. If Anne is red and Anne is nice then Anne is rough. If something is red and round then it is smart. All round things are furry. All blue, round things are red. Blue things are nice. All nice, blue things are furry. All red things are smart. Question: Bob is not smart.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Bob : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Blue Anne
axiom T2 : Nice Anne
axiom T3 : Red Anne
axiom T4 : Rough Anne
axiom T5 : Round Anne
axiom T6 : Smart Anne
axiom T7 : Blue Bob
axiom T8 : Blue Dave
axiom T9 : Rough Dave
axiom T10 : Smart Dave
axiom T11 : Blue Harry
axiom T12 : Furry Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x → Round x
axiom R2 : Red Anne ∧ Nice Anne → Rough Anne
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Red x ∧ Round x → Smart x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Round x → Furry x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x ∧ Round x → Red x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x → Nice x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x ∧ Blue x → Furry x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Smart x

theorem bob_is_not_smart : ¬ Smart Bob :=
begin
  sorry
end

-- Looks like it cannot be proven in Lean.
-- So let's try to prove the negation of the theorem, which is Bob is smart

theorem bob_is_smart : Smart Bob :=
begin
  apply R8,
  apply R5,
  split,
  exact T7,
  apply R1,
  apply R7,
  split,
  exact T7,
  apply R6,
  exact T7,
end

-- It can be proven in Lean. So
-- The answer is False
